item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, December 13, 2024 at 8:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. MarkItDown: Python tool for converting files and office documents to Markdown (120 points | 31 comments)
2. Garbage Collected Smart Pointers in Rust via Concurrent Cycle Collection (72 points | 32 comments)
3. Making my first robot as a software engineer (97 points | 13 comments)
4. Show HN: Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 (90 points | 20 comments)
5. Web Origami, for making websites where you can understand how they're made (121 points | 31 comments)
6. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (123 points | 14 comments)
7. Show HN: @smoores/epub, a JavaScript library for working with EPUB publications (10 points | 2 comments)
8. Ask HN: What should I do with meet.hn? (58 points | 40 comments)
9. Donald Bitzer has died (119 points | 13 comments)
10. New Superconductors Delight and Confound (9 points | discuss)
11. Show HN: Rain hashes – well designed, simple and fast variable sized hashes (58 points | 15 comments)
12. "All your base are belong to us" intro to my 2004 MIT Spam Conference talk (13 points | 3 comments)
13. HyperDX (YC S22) Is Hiring Engineers to Build Open Source Observability ( | hide)
14. An Italian town that built its own sun (2021) (22 points | 3 comments)
15. Test (298 points | 72 comments)

21. Three Mistakes from Dart/Flutter's Weak PRNG (56 points | 61 comments)
22. Bit-permuting 16 u32s at once with AVX-512 (8 points | discuss)
23. A tale of demonic possession predicted the decline of an early medieval empire (46 points | 39 comments)
24. A new video captures a 1968 demo of IBM’s Executive Terminal (299 points | 77 comments)
25. Computer Graphics Archaeology: The HP 9845C Demo (2013) (4 points | 1 comment)
26. The pills that cured all ills; James Morison the Hygeist (2014) (21 points | 8 comments)
27. The Errors of TeX [pdf] (1989) (7 points | discuss)
28. Hexagonal Architecture and Rails (4 points | discuss)
29. People who are good at reading have different brains (69 points | 51 comments)
30. The world of tomorrow (87 points | 77 comments)
